website_summaries.verdict: The Pentax K-S2 D-SLR packs a lot of features into its weather-sealed body, but its burst shooting capability is very limited and its companion Wi-Fi app needs some work.
cons: Lacks continuous focus in video mode

customer_reviews.title: A class act!
customer_reviews.text: Well, where do I start? I got this for £399 on a weekend deal, the current price being around £546 & it is a real bargain! It's a compact dslr, a little on the heavy side, which performs impeccably. I may be a bit biased, being a long time Pentax user but I do own a Nikon dslr plus a full frame csc & 2 micro 4 thirds cameras & this beauty outperforms them all! If you're a first time buyer this could be the only top class camera you'll ever need. To see images taken with this combo. Check out Keefy 243 on Flickr.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent upper mid-range digital camera
customer_reviews.text: this is the 3rd body of this specific camera that I now own. Upgraded from wet film to digital last year and wanted to keep my old Pentax fit lenses. If your thinking of going digital with a Pentax fit, this is an excellent upper mid-range digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Giant killer in a small package
customer_reviews.text: This is just a great camera at a great price. It's no surprise this bit of kit is giving the Canikon fan boys a jolt. A weather proofed camera that's got a surprising number of enthusiast features at a beginner's price. The dual control dials are another feature you won't see replicated at this spend level. There's not much in the way of competition particularly when you realise how easy it is to put some fantastic legacy glass on the front and achieve superb results.
customer_reviews.author: Navanski

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Pentax KS2 deal
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe when I saw the Pentax KS2 with the 18-135 mm lens for sale for £399 - early days but so far I am discovering the wide range of features. Arrived within a couple of days too. Part 2. I have recently returned from Scotland where I photographed a wedding near Stirling and landscapes on the Isle of Skye. Camera behaved superbly - long exposures with filters were successful using LCD screen, manual settings and the histogram in very wet conditions. Very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: psalterlaner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gear.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera, Pentax and parent company Ricoh have in the past produced some of the finest and most innovative of photographic products of which the KS-2 is no exception. I sold my Nikon kit ( 5100 and 3300) to buy my KS-2 and don't for a moment regret it. One minor niggle though is that lenses are very expensive and not as plentiful as other marques.
